messages.subject: Re:Attention Lego Lovers
messages.msgSnippet: My son signed up on Lego.com several months ago and is very disappointed that he hasn t received his free lego gift that he thought he was supposed to get.
messages.messageBody:
My son signed up on Lego.com several months ago and is very
disappointed that he hasn't received his free lego gift that he
thought he was supposed to get. Did we do something wrong? Also, I
think he would love to interact with others on this site. How do you
go about that?

Thanks,
Beth-

Beth,

Tyler will enjoy that. He is shadowninja95. He was
on just a little while ago. Let me know if Will would
like it, and when he will be on, and I will get Tyler
on there too. He is having alot of fun on there.

Take care!!!

Vanessa

messages.subject: Attention Lego Lovers
messages.msgSnippet: This may be old news for some but we just discovered, while playing around on the Lego website, under downloads there is a program - FREE - that lets you build
messages.messageBody:
This may be old news for some but we just discovered, while playing
around on the Lego website, under downloads there is a program - FREE -
that lets you build Lego creations on the screen. It is called Lego
Digital Designer. You can then see and print the instructions for your
completed project...you can even go further and send them to Lego and
receive, (after payment for the bricks) the complete package in the mail
with the pieces necessary and directions for your model! You can even
design the packaging!! How cool is that. Ethan and Claire were up till
midnight playing around with the features. You can also save and share
your creations in the online gallery.
Amazing...and FREE!!!

Have fun,
Amy
